short_summary: Tenders are being invited for Rectangular structures - Upgrading Ramps or Bridges, building Maintenance, renewal, and reconstructing a series of Bridge replacement for pedestrian bridges located Lac Leamy PATHWAY. Overall Design and supervision of the new DEVELOPMENT DEVELOP consist of replacing previous wooden deck with NEW wood. More information is available with Procurement),
description: The National Capital Commission (NCC) is a federal Crown corporation created by Canada’s Parliament in 1959 under the National Capital Act. Building on more than a century of experience, the NCC provides unique value in the Capital Region by fulfilling three specific roles: long-term planner of federal lands, principal steward of nationally significant public places, and creative partner committed to excellence in development and conservation. The NCC is seeking services to remove the existing wooden deck on two pedestrian bridges located on the Lac Leamy pathway and replace it with white oak deck timbers. The work also includes the installation of new structural steel railing post support assemblies including the removal, salvage and reinstallation of the existing railing on the new supports.

full_summary:
# Tender: Deck Replacement for Pedestrian Bridges at Lac-Leamy

## Background

The National Capital Commission (NCC) invites eligible bidders to submit a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the replacement of the existing wooden decks on two pedestrian bridges located on the Lac-Leamy pathway.

## Project Overview

The NCC seeks to remove the existing wooden decks and replace them with white oak deck timbers. The contract also includes the installation of new structural steel railing post support assemblies, including the removal, salvage, and reinstallation of the existing railing on the new supports.

## Bidding Information

* Tender Reference Number: cb-5880-18079632
* Amendment Number: 4
* Solicitation Number: PL008
* Tender Closing Date: June 21, 2023, at 15:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: July 4, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: October 27, 2023

## Tender Description

This tender is a Request for Proposal, which will be evaluated based on lowest price.

## Interested Bidders

Eligible bidders are invited to submit a proposal as per the instructions outlined in the tender document. The NCC prefers electronic submissions via email to [bids-soumissions@ncc-ccn.ca](mailto:bids-soumissions@ncc-ccn.ca).

## Contact Information

For any queries related to this tender, please contact Philippe Lupien, Sr. Contract Officer:

* Email: [philippe.lupien@ncc-ccn.ca](mailto:philippe.lupien@ncc-ccn.ca)
* Phone: (343) 552-5976

## References

* Tender document: [Available on CanadaBuys website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/)
* Addenda: [Available on CanadaBuys website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/)

Note: The above text was rewritten to ensure clarity, coherence, and conciseness while maintaining the essential details of the original text. It was formatted in markdown to make it easier to read and understand. The tone has been made more professional, and the language has been adjusted to suit a technical writing style.
